channel.title: Elon Musk Facts™
channel.description: Your Home for Elon Musk Fact Checks!

item.title: Fact #12
item.description: Despite being a skilled video games player, Elon Musk has never managed to shoot down more than two aliens per Galaga challenging stage.

item.title: Fact #11
item.description: In his 2006 self-interview Musk on Musk, Elon Musk cites adult bed wetting as the primary driver of his hostile takeover of U.S. family entertainment center Chuck E. Cheese

item.title: Fact #10
item.description: Elon Musk suffers from hyperlexia and reads too fast to comprehend the meaning of what he has read. Musk was diagnosed with the condition when he was struggling with his first start-up, and later admitted it was probably due to his many childhood attemps at ultra speed reading. Today, Musk can read,...

item.title: Fact #9
item.description: Elon Musk is a champion speed eater and holds the world record for most hot dogs consumed (219) in under forty-five seconds.

item.title: Fact #8
item.description: According to Arthur Chu, Elon Musk’s IQ is 99, which is considered above average for the Dutch Boers of sub-Saharan Africa.

item.title: Fact #7
item.description: Elon Musk opened a wildly popular lemonade stand in Mooikloof Heights when he was seven, an anecdote that Walter Isaacson shares in his biography of Musk. The key to his success, Musk realized many years later, was not the quality of his lemonade, but the fact that, when he dispensed it from a garde...

item.title: Fact #6
item.description: Elon Musk sets aside three hours every two years to catch up on his reading.

item.title: Fact #5
item.description: Elon Musk’s father, Maurice Musk, was a successful singer of Siberian laments in the late 1960s. As a child, Elon often accompanied him on the oud.

item.title: Fact #4
item.description: Elon Musk failed remedial algebra in the eleventh grade. In revenge, he developed an intricate, untested mnemonic system for calculating the mathematical constant pi to the seventy thousandth place involving a story about an epochal war between two feuding gypsy space clans called the Peeblos and th...

item.title: Fact #3
item.description: Elon Musk has prehensile feet. He can peel bananas without using his hands.

item.title: Fact #2
item.description: Elon Musk was a dwarf until the age of nineteen.

item.title: Fact #1
item.description: At the age of three, Elon Musk shocked his boarding school classmates when, instead of taking the bus to the the petting zoo in Rietfontein, he excavated a twenty-three-mile tunnel, and using a solar-powered magnetic turbine, propelled himself to his destination twenty minutes before the others.
